course title: 30555 Microwave remote sensing models and data
Course type:
MSc
Programme specific course (MSc), Earth and Space Physics Engineering
Scope and form: The teaching is a combination of lectures, groupwork, reading of scientific literature and practical programming exercises. Focus is on hands-on implementation of models and model modules and data processing using the models.
General course objectives:
General course objectives
The overall aim with the course is to give an introduction to microwave emission and scattering models and to implement and use the models with satellite data.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Critically appraise scientific literature
Explain the most important physical state parameters in the ice, ocean atmospheric system
Explain different radar and radiometer satellite systems and their measurements
Implement models and model modules from the scientific literature as code
Appraise the relationship between the physical state of the ice, ocean and atmosphere and the measured backscatter and microwave radiance
Explain the sensitivity of backscatter and radiance to the physical state of ice, ocean and atmosphere using models
Evaluate models using validation data
Analyze relevant remote sensing data using models and retrieve the physical state of the ice, ocean and atmosphere system
Discuss the retrieved physical parameters and their relevance in ice, ocean and atmospheric modeling and climate assessment
Content:
The course introduces the following topics:
Microwave remote sensing of the ice, ocean and atmosphere,
Primary, secondary and tertiary microwave emission and scattering model parameters,
Emission models,
Scattering models,
Ocean, ice and atmospheric radiometry,
Sea surface temperature and sea ice concentration integrated retrievals and other applications.

This course provides students with competencies relevant to UN SDGs, for example, #13 (Climate Action), and #14 (Life below water).
Course literature: Tonboe, R. T. (2023). Modeling Microwave Emission and Scattering from Snow-Covered Sea Ice. In M. Shokr, & N. K. Sinha (Eds.), Sea Ice: Physics and Remote Sensing (2. ed.). Wiley. https://doi.org/10.1002/9781119828242.ch12
